topics.body:
I think I'm going to need a lobodomy after watching the kantai anime.

I know you guys don't want to hear about it but why the hell would you take a harem romance franchise and turn it into a action anime that stripped everything about why people liked the franchise in the first place?

That would be like if you made a movie off the cartoon avatar then removed any emotion the actors have powered down the bending to the point it takes five people to move a rock an. . . bad example.
. . Okay it would be like if you made a transformers movie that instead of focusing on Optimus Prime instead focused on a annoying actor's relationship with his girlfriend and the majority of the time focusing on them instead when the next movie his girlfriend will just replaced anyho.  . . bad example.
. . Okay it would be like if you made a Dragonball movie and instead made it into a avatar the last airbender clone where the Goku works at a movie theat. . bad example.

Why is it that so many franchises whenever they get their own tv show or movies they have a habit of stripping everything about the original that people liked about the original?
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.body:
"@SquiggyBomb":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54b706026368726e95571300#post_54b706026368726e95571300
It's a harem dating game disguised as a action card game.  If you're wondering what I mean by this you can in the game marry *all* 221 of the girls with one account.  The people that say they play the card game for the action is being about as truthful as the people who say they read BigTits' magazines for the editorials.
